p: The greatest proportion of specimens (50%) were those of B. antiquus and B. occidentalis that were dated between 7,000 and 13,000 years ago, whereas 38% of the specimens were those of B. bison from 3,000 years ago to present. Average annual temperatures varied over 25°C on the scale of Greenland temperature over the last 40,000 years, which was equivalent to a span of 6°C on the relative global scale (Figure 5).
